H0.text: Parasitism is the type of relationship represented by clownfish taking shelter in the tentacles of sea anemones and keeping sea anemones clean.

H1.text: Commensalism is the type of relationship represented by clownfish taking shelter in the tentacles of sea anemones and keeping them clean.

H2.text: Mutualism is the type of relationship that describes clownfish taking shelter in the tentacles of sea anemones while keeping the sea anemones clean.

H3.text: Neutralism is the type of relationship in which clownfish take shelter in the tentacles of sea anemones and keep sea anemones clean.

A4.text: The territorial fish protects the anemone from anemone-eating fish, and in turn, the anemone stinging tentacles protect the clownfish from its predators.

A5.text: An example of mutualism is the relationship between the ocellaris clownfish that dwell among the tentacles of Riterri sea anemones.
